name: 2011_11_humanities_student_major_269_engineering
title: 2011-11-humanities-student-major_269_engineering.txt
content_scrubbed:
Sure. 

The University (administration) has done everything they can to fuck me over and chase me away, but I've persisted through the idiotic bureaucratic raging storms they create. 

The University (faculty/staff-educational) has been a dream, working around my schedules, resolving my screw-ups, the only niggling problem is they like to schedule massive clumps of courses at the same time, so that three things I need are schedule concurrently (as an example), which means I have taken five years to complete a degree I should have been able to finish in three. 

But, in the meantime, I've received two undergraduate research experiences (NSF-REU) that have paid handsomely and been an absolutely amazingly invaluable experience (including a ten week all-expenses-paid trip to BFE for cross-disciplinary research, and four week-long trips to VERY NICE places for conferences), and been selected for an Entrepreneurship program that is helping me get my business off the ground. 

As a "non-traditional" undergrad at 30 with a Liberal Arts degree, I'm a bit older than half my classmates, and the other half are ex-military, married, with children. But I've also got more experience in and out of the field, and my BLA (emphasis English / Communications, some work in Sociology/Anthropology and Philosophy) means that I know how to write and speak better than most of my classmates, so I generally get picked to lead any projects we do, and be the main presenter.

Since I now have 240 credit hours for three degrees (BLA, EE, CompE), and I'm only 30 away from a fourth degree in Physics, and eight credits from a fifth degree in Math, and eight credits from a Minor in Entrepreneurship (already have a cert in it), all of which I can finish any time in the next seven years, I'm well set up to really build my CV into a powerhouse. However, since I'm raising funds to get my company running, and every potential investor I speak to is VERY positive about our products and business plan, I probably don't need any more padding or degrees. 

I currently owe around $40,000 for everything, since my first attempt was almost entirely funded by scholarships, but if my company is funded I'll be making $75k right out of the gate, I'm not worried about my debt load. 

What specifically would you like to know?
